metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7041 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The pam_userdb module for Pam uses a case-insensitive method to compare hashed passwords, which makes it easier for attackers to guess the password via a brute force attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7041` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-cracklib - 1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1
libpam-modules - 1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1
libpam-modules-bin - 1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1
libpam-runtime - 1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1
libpam0g - 1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> see additional comments in oss-security thread

criterions.comment: pam package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.8-1ubuntu2.1').
